00099                 
00100                 // Error - Bad DBAL configuration
00101                 throw new tx_oop_Database_Layer_Exception(
00102                     'Invalid configuration of the \'dbal\' extension.',
00103                     tx_oop_Database_Layer_Exception::EXCEPTION_DBAL_INVALID_CONF
00104                 );
00105             }
00106             
00107             // Gets the DBAL configuration

00109             
00110             // Checks if the DBAL is configured to use MySQL
00111             if( $dbalConf[ 'type' ] === 'native' ) {
00112                 
00113                 // No need for a particular setup
00114                 break;
00115             }
00116             
00117             // Checks the DBAL configuration
00118             if( !isset( $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'driver' ] )
00119                 || !isset( $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'username' ] )
00120                 || !isset( $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'password' ] )
00121                 || !isset( $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'host' ] )

00128                     tx_oop_Database_Layer_Exception::EXCEPTION_DBAL_INVALID_CONF
00129                 );
00130             }
00131             
00132             // Sets the connection infos from the DBAL configuration
00133             $driver = $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'driver' ];
00134             $user   = $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'username' ];
00135             $pass   = $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'password' ];
00136             $host   = $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'host' ];
00137             $db     = $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'database' ];
00138         }
00139         
00140         // Checks if PDO supports the Drupal database driver
00141         if( !isset( $this->_drivers[ $driver ] ) ) {

00161             
00162             // Creates the PDO object
00163             $this->_pdo = new PDO( $this->_dsn, $user, $pass );

00170                 tx_oop_Database_Layer_Exception::EXCEPTION_NO_CONNECTION

00187     /**
00188      * PHP method calls overloading
00189      * 
00190      * This method will reroute all the call on this object to the PDO object.
00191      * 
00192      * @param   string                          The name of the called method
00193      * @param   array                           The arguments for the called method
00194      * @return  mixed                           The result of the PDO method called
00195      * @throws  tx_oop_Database_Layer_Exception If the called method does not exist
00196      */
00197     public function __call( $name, array $args = array() )
00198     {
00199         // Checks if the method can be called
00200         if( !is_callable( array( $this->_pdo, $name ) ) ) {
00201             
00202             // Called method does not exist
00203             throw new tx_oop_Database_Layer_Exception(
00204                 'The method \'' . $name . '\' cannot be called on the PDO object',
00205                 tx_oop_Database_Layer_Exception::EXCEPTION_BAD_METHOD
00206             );
00207         }
00208         
00209         // Gets the number of arguments
00210         $argCount = count( $args );
00211         
00212         // We won't use call_user_func_array, as it cannot return references
00213         switch( $argCount ) {
00214             
00215             case 1:
00216                 
00217                 return $this->_pdo->$name( $args[ 0 ] );
00218                 break;
00219             
00220             case 2:
00221                 
00222                 return $this->_pdo->$name( $args[ 0 ], $args[ 1 ] );
00223                 break;
00224             
00225             case 3:
00226                 
00227                 return $this->_pdo->$name( $args[ 0 ], $args[ 1 ], $args[ 2 ] );
00228                 break;
00229             
00230             case 4:
00231                 
00232                 return $this->_pdo->$name( $args[ 0 ], $args[ 1 ], $args[ 2 ], $args[ 3 ] );
00233                 break;
00234                 break;
00235             
00236             case 5:
00237                 
00238                 return $this->_pdo->$name( $args[ 0 ], $args[ 1 ], $args[ 2 ], $args[ 3 ], $args[ 4 ] );
00239                 break;
00240             
00241             default:
00242                 
00243                 return $this->_pdo->$name();
00244                 break;
00245         }
00246     }

00313     public function getRecord( $table, $id, $enableFields = true )
00314     {
00315         // WHERE clause for the enable fields
00316         $enableFieldsAddWhere = ( $enableFields ) ? $this->enableFields( $table ) : '';
00317         
00318         // Primary key
00319         $pKey   = 'uid';
00320         
00321         // Parameters for the PDO query
00322         $params = array(
00323             ':id' => $id
00324         );
00325         
00326         // Prepares the PDO query
00327         $query = $this->prepare(
00328             'SELECT * FROM ' . $table . '
00329              WHERE ' . $pKey . ' = :id'
00330            . $enableFieldsAddWhere . '
00331              LIMIT 1'
00332         );
00333         
00334         // Executes the PDO query
00335         $query->execute( $params );
00336         
00337         // Returns the record
00338         return $query->fetchObject();

00344     public function getRecordsByFields( $table, array $fieldsValues, $orderBy = '', $enableFields = true  )
00345     {
00346         // If $orderBy is not specified, checks if we have a default ORDER BY clause for the table
00347         if( !$orderBy && isset( $GLOBALS[ 'TCA' ][ $table ][ 'ctrl' ][ 'default_sortby' ] ) ) {
00348             
00349             // Default ORDER BY clause, as in the TCA
00350             $orderBy = ' ' . $GLOBALS[ 'TCA' ][ $table ][ 'ctrl' ][ 'default_sortby' ];
00351             
00352         } elseif( $orderBy ) {
00353             
00354             // Specified ORDER BY clause
00355             $orderBy = ' ORDER BY ' . $orderBy;
00356         }
00357         
00358         // WHERE clause for the enable fields
00359         $enableFieldsAddWhere = ( $enableFields ) ? $this->enableFields( $table ) : '';
00360         
00361         // Primary key
00362         $pKey   = 'uid';
00363         
00364         // Starts the query
00365         $sql = 'SELECT * FROM ' . $table . ' WHERE ';
00366         
00367         // Parameters for the PDO query
00368         $params = array();
00369         
00370         // Process each field to check
00371         foreach( $fieldsValues as $fieldName => $fieldValue ) {
00372             
00373             // Adds the parameter
00374             $params[ ':' . $fieldName ] = $fieldValue;
00375             
00376             // Adds the statement
00377             $sql .= $fieldName . ' = :' . $fieldName . ' AND ';
00378         }
00379         
00380         // Removes the last 'AND'
00381         $sql = substr( $sql, 0, -5 );
00382         
00383         // Adds the WHERE clause for the enable fields
00384         $sql .= $enableFieldsAddWhere;
00385         
00386         // Adds the ORDER BY clause
00387         $sql .= $orderBy;
00388         
00389         // Prepares the PDO query
00390         $query = $this->prepare( $sql );
00391         
00392         // Executes the PDO query
00393         $query->execute( $params );
00394         
00395         // Storage
00396         $rows = array();
00397         
00398         // Process each row
00399         while( $row = $query->fetchObject() ) {
00400             
00401             // Stores the current row
00402             $rows[ $row->$pKey ] = $row;
00403         }
00404         
00405         // Returns the rows
00406         return $rows;
00407     }
